abstracts.cdata!:
The project would rehabilitate
            Iceland's southwest coast fisheries, which have been
            seriously hampered by the volcanic eruption in
            Vestmannaeyjar, through improvement and expansion of three
            small and overcrowded harbors on the mainland, where part of
            the evacuated Vestmannaeyjar fleet of 80 vessels has
            currently taken refuge. The project comprises: (1) detailed
            engineering (including a model hydraulic study) and
            construction of a new breakwater, basin and quays at
            Thorlakshofn; (2) construction of new quays, dredging of the
            basin, rockblasting and dredging of the channel and entrance
            at Grindavik, and; (3) construction of a new quay at Hornafjordur.
